title: A Beginner's Guide to Buying Facebook Stock
text: As an investor, you may think Facebook is a great buy or a bad deal. Here's how to make an informed decision for or against it, by the numbers.

title: Facebook is pivoting
text: “The future is private,” said Mark Zuckerberg of Facebook’s roadmap, after conceding “we don’t exactly have the strongest reputation on privacy right now, to put it lightly.” But it’s easy to see why he would genuinely want that … now.

title: Growing concerns over Facebook's hate speech ban
text: RNC Committeewoman Harmeet Dhillon on Facebook's efforts to ban what it considers hate speech.

title: Facebook’s Cryptocoin: Where Do We Sign Up?
text: One thing to say for Facebook Inc. (NASDAQ: FB): the company thinks inside the box.

title: When it comes to elections, Facebook moves slow, may still break things
text: This week, Facebook invited a small group of journalists — which didn’t include TechCrunch — to look at the “war room” it has set up in Dublin, Ireland, to help monitor its products for election-related content that violates its policies. title: Facebook launches its first major ad campaign under new CMO Antonio Lucio, and it's all about Groups
text: The new campaign promotes Facebook Groups, which will feature prominently in the new version of the Facebook app.

title: WaPo: Facebook Open To Working With Regulators To Increase Oversight Of Privacy Practices
text: Facebook Inc. informed the U.S. government it will submit to greater oversight of its data-collection practices after a probe into a series of privacy abuses last year, according to The Washington Post.

title: WSJ: Facebook Looking To Make Cryptocurrency Push
text: Facebook, Inc. has ambitious plans to build out a cryptocurrency-supported payment system and is reaching out to dozens of financial firms and merchants, The Wall Street Journal reported.

title: Too much regulation will hand tech leadership to China, says former Facebook board member
text: Former Facebook board member Donald Graham says too much regulation of American tech firms will elevate Chinese companies.

title: Reddit Co-founder Alexis Ohanian on Facebook, IPOs and more
text: Alexis Ohanian, co-founder of Reddit and Initialized Capital, joins "Squawk Box" at Berkshire Hathaway's annual investor meeting to discuss a wide range of topics including Facebook's new policy to ban public figures that it says "promote or engage in violence and hate.

title: Facebook is creating a cryptocurrency payments system
text: Will social-media users draw a red line with Mark Zuckerberg’s financial-services ambitions?

title: Facebook working on cryptocurrency-based payments platform
text: Effort could be crypto’s most mainstream application to date

title: Facebook is reportedly looking for allies to support its planned cryptocurrency payment service
text: Facebook has spoken with various companies, including Visa and MasterCard, about the project, which is known internally as Project Libra, according to the report.

title: Facebook Bans Far-Right Figures for Policy Violations
text: Facebook Inc. said it’s banning a number of controversial far-right figures for violating the social-media company’s policies on hate speech and promoting violence. Bloomberg's Kurt Wagner has more on "Bloomberg Technology."

title: Facebook bans extremist leaders for far-right, anti-semitic speech
text: “A New Textbook of Americanism” author Jonathan Hoenig, former investment banker Carol Roth, Kaltbaum Capital Management President Gary Kaltbaum and FBN’s Kristina Partsinevelos on how Facebook banned extremist figures from its website.

title: Instagram's Latest Feature Could Make Insta-Shopping Huge
text: Get ready for more shoppable posts, now featuring your favorite Instagram influencers.

title: Investors focused on Facebook's better monetization, not privacy: Internet analyst
text: FB analyst Mark Mahaney with RBC Capital Markets, discusses what investors are looking for in Facebook.

title: FTC dealing with Facebook could signal vigorous enforcement to come: Pro
text: CNBC's "Power Lunch" team breaks down the new privacy oversight on the table for Facebook and CEO Mark Zuckerberg with Nancy Scola, Politico technology reporter that broke the story, and Ryan Radia, an adjunct fellow for CEI, a lobbying group promoting limited regulation.

title: Facebook bans a fresh batch of mostly far-right figures
text: Facebook just announced its latest mini-purge of controversial accounts that violate its rules against “dangerous individuals and organizations.” In this round Facebook newly cracked down on Milo Yiannopoulos, Paul Joseph Watson, Laura Loomer, Paul Nehlen, Louis Farrakhan.

title: Takeaways from F8 and Facebook’s next phase
text: Extra Crunch offers members the opportunity to tune into conference calls led and moderated by the TechCrunch writers you read every day. This week, TechCrunch’s Josh Constine and Frederic Lardinois discuss major announcements that came out of Facebook’s F8 conference and dig into how Facebook is trying to redefine itself for the future.

title: Daily Crunch: Facebook shows off an aspirational redesign
text: The Daily Crunch is TechCrunch’s roundup of our biggest and most important stories. If you’d like to get this delivered to your inbox every day at around 9am Pacific, you can subscribe here.

title: High tech needs to work closer with government: Former Cisco CEO
text: Recode editor-at-large Kara Swisher and Cisco former CEO John Chambers join "Squawk Alley" to discuss the future of the internet with A.I. and automation and how to regulate privacy from companies like Facebook.

title: Here are some ways Facebook can address privacy concerns
text: Facebook is reportedly creating a committee to safeguard users' data.

title: Dead Facebook users may outnumber living users by 2070: Study
text: Julie Hyman of Yahoo Finance discusses the the Facebook study by the Oxford Internet Institute, that suggests the amount of dead Facebook users may outnumber the living on the social platform by the year 2070.

title: Facebook settlement with the US reportedly may include a privacy oversight committee
text: Facebook and the Federal Trade Commission are negotiating a possible settlement that would require the company to create an independent privacy oversight committee.

title: FTC may require more privacy oversight at Facebook: report
text: Facebook Inc. FB, -0.19% is negotiating a settlement with the Federal Trade Commission that would require it to install a privacy official at the company's highest ranks, Politico reported late Wednesday.

title: Facebook pivots to what it wishes it was
text: In Facebook’s dreams, it’s a clean and private place.

title: The genius move behind Facebook groups: Mining users for more valuable data
text: Unveiling the social network’s redesign, Mark Zuckerberg talked up digital ‘living rooms’ where people can have more revealing, intimate conversations

title: Cramer calls Zuckerberg 'tone-deaf' after CEO's privacy joke bombs at developers conference
text: Mark Zuckerberg's joke about Facebook's privacy scandals during the company's F8 developer conference didn't land well, CNBC's Jim Cramer said.

title: What's next for Facebook?
text: What's next for Facebook? - Fortt Knox.

title: Mark Zuckerberg explains how Facebook will make big bucks from privacy: Payments and commerce
text: Facebook on Tuesday announced a bevy of new shopping features for its various apps, setting a business foundation for the company's pivot to privacy.

title: Facebook updates PyTorch with a focus on production use
text: During last year’s F8 developer conference, Facebook announced the 1.0 launch of PyTorch, the company’s open source deep learning platform.

title: Facebook open-sources Ax and BoTorch to simplify AI model optimization
text: At its F8 developer conference, Facebook today launched Ax and BoTorch, two new open-source AI tools. BoTorch, which, as the name implies, is based on PyTorch, is a library for Bayesian optimization.

title: We don't need FAANG stocks to carry the market higher, says portfolio manager
text: Jenny Harrington, CEO and portfolio manager at Gilman Hill Asset Management, and the "Fast Money Halftime Report" traders discuss the FAANG stocks and their momentum in the market.

title: Why Facebook Share Prices Keep Going Up, Even Though Nobody Trusts the Company
text: When Facebook Inc. announced its first-quarter financial results last week, the company said it had set aside $3 billion to pay for an expected fine of between $3 billion and $5 billion from the U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC).

title: 'It will take time for people to forgive Facebook,' says Gene Munster
text: Loup Ventures Managing Partner Gene Munster discusses Facebook's new re-design and focus on privacy.

title: Oculus Quest: The Exciting, Exhausting Future of Gaming
text: Oculus has built a surprisingly fun VR game console, the $400 Quest, that puts you inside a game and lets you move around.

text: Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg made a joke on privacy at the company's developer conference that did not land with the audience.

title: Facebook could have nearly 5 billion dead users by 2100, research claims
text: Hundreds of millions of "dead profiles" will be added to Facebook's network in the next few decades, a study found, raising questions about how the data of the deceased is being handled.
